summary: This is a statement from a security consultant detailing the security services provided to Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest on July 2, 2020. It describes the security threats she faced, the protocols in place, the circumstances of her arrest, and the consultant's company's offer to post a $1 million bond for her bail application.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary subject of the security consultant's statement. She received security services due to death threats and press harassment, was arrested on July 2, 2020, and is the subject of a bail application supported by the consultant's bond.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of death threats against Ghislaine Maxwell due to her relationship with him approximately 20 years prior.

persons.name: Princess Diana
persons.context: Cited as an example of the life-threatening dangers of press intrusion into personal space.

connections.description: Ghislaine Maxwell received death threats connected to her relationship with Jeffery Epstein from approximately 20 years prior.
The security consultant provided security services and consultation for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest, and his company is posting a $1 million bond for her bail.

events.title: Announcement of Epstein's Death
events.description: Following the announcement of Jeffrey Epstein's death, a risk assessment indicated Ghislaine Maxwell was at substantial risk, leading to enhanced security protocols.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: FBI agents arrested Ghislaine Maxwell at a residence in Bradford, New Hampshire, after a security consultant on duty reported suspicious activity.

events.title: Statement and Bond Offer
events.description: A security consultant signed a statement detailing services provided to Maxwell and offering to post a $1 million bond in support of her bail application.

locations: Barrington House, Hereford HR4 0BQ, United Kingdom
keyFacts: A security consultant provided protection for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest on July 2, 2020, due to death threats linked to Jeffrey Epstein and aggressive press behavior.
On the morning of her arrest, a security operative reported a helicopter and vehicles approaching the property, initially suspecting the press, before FBI agents arrived and arrested Maxwell.
The security consultant's company, Sparta Security Services, offered to post a $1 million bond for Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application, a first for the consultant.
Security protocols for Maxwell included moving to a safe room with supplies and barricades in the event of a threat.
The statement is signed and dated November 25, 2020, in support of Maxwell's renewed bail application.
